name: places/ChIJQ8upzAj2wokRdQNOgCZIOis

displayName.text: Academy of St. Paul & St. Ann

formattedAddress: 114 E 118th St, New York, NY 10035, USA
adrFormatAddress: 114 E 118th St, New York, NY 10035-3999, USA

originalText.text: Wonderful staff!!! Mr. Barnaba is a great Principal. During the pandemic he kept our children safe and made sure the school was safe. Sr. Truth , Sr. Consolation , & Sr. Maryellen are beautiful and they teach children about Jesus Christ. I love that the teachers are professional and they help my kids learn better in school. My kid’s teachers are dedicated and I appreciate their hard work. Thank you very much for a great school year!!

originalText.text: Amazing and caring teachers in their 3K and Pre K programs. The staff communicates well with each parent.  I only give 4 stars because they can improve on challenging kids who are more advanced. Otherwise, a great atmosphere for first time school goers.

text.text: Amazing and caring teachers in their 3K and Pre K programs. The staff communicates well with each parent.  I only give 4 stars because they can improve on challenging kids who are more advanced. Otherwise, a great atmosphere for first time school goers.

originalText.text:
Long story behind this 1 star.  If i could give a -1
I would.  The only good experience was my children's teacher Ms.Feliciano. Such an amazing individual that left an impact on my kids. Everyday they'll talked about what they've learned and memorized all the sweet songs they were taught ❣ wish we could've brought her along to the new school. Besides that the school is awful. Also if you ever have an issue with staff and request to speak to the principal just know he/she doesn't care and you will not receive a call.  I definitely didn't.

originalText.text:
I hope what happened to me is not a representation of how this school functions. I wanted to enroll my son. I paid the registration fee completed the documents and that's where it ended. I called left messages, nothing. So I had to enroll him in another school. My check dated for 6/12/15 was never cashed over a month later.  Finally in August I received a call from a lady, stating he  was accepted. I told the lady I already enrolled him in another school and to and to shred my check if you find it. Late August I started receiving calls from a guy about my son's enrollment. I'm like wow, this school is unorganized. Im not calling him back. I definitely don't want to send him here. Apparently, almost 2.5 months later this school finds my check and cashed it. Clearly not communicating with each and basically disregarding the fact that you have not touched basis with the child's parent to even confirm if this child will be attending. How money hungry can you be that despite your inability reach the parent and obviously to effectively run a school, you'd basically steal money.  I pray this school rights, it's wrong because this is one situation I will escalate to the Archdiocese. Is their any righteousness left in the world?

"As the thief is shamed when he is discovered so the house of Israel is shamed, They, their kings, their prince's, their priests and their prophets."

originalText.text: Worst school ever!!! I was a student there and many of the teachers there are very disrespectful they DO NOT care about the child's education they will constantly threaten the kids with" I DON'T CARE, YOU DO WHAT YOU WANT I'M THE GETTING PAID NOT YOU."  As I was there it got to the point where a teacher would slam books from your hand just because you didn't tuck in  your shirt. it is such a horrible school do not recommend, On top of that its a waste of time, money, and it sets your kid back and it would be hard to help your child once they get to high school. They take so much money and they don't even use it for the students it still to this day makes me question what do they use it for.  ONCE AGAIN I DO NOT RECOMMEND THIS SCHOOL!!!!!
